title: Authentication
content:
Authentication
Our API uses token-based authentication to secure your requests.
Getting Your API Key
Log into your dashboard
Navigate to Settings > API Keys
Click "Generate New Key"
Copy and store your key securely
Making Authenticated Requests
Include your API key in the Authorization header:
Authentication Errors
Common authentication errors and solutions:
401 Unauthorized
This means your API key is invalid or missing.
403 Forbidden
Your API key is valid but doesn't have permission for this resource.

title: Code Examples
content:
Code Examples
This page demonstrates various code block examples with syntax highlighting.
JavaScript Example
TypeScript with Interface
JSON Configuration

Python Example
Plain Text

title: Data API
content:
Data API
The Data API allows you to manage data resources programmatically.
Endpoints
Get All Data Resources
Retrieves a list of all data resources.
Query Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | integer | Page number for pagination (default: 1) |
|  | integer | Number of results per page (default: 20, max: 100) |
|  | string | Filter by resource type |
|  | string | Filter by status (active, archived, draft) |
|  | string | ISO date to filter by creation date |
Response
Get Data Resource by ID
Retrieves a specific data resource by ID.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the resource |
Response
Create Data Resource
Creates a new data resource.
Request Body
Response
Update Data Resource
Updates an existing data resource.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the resource |
Request Body
Response
Delete Data Resource
Deletes a data resource.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the resource |
Response
Error Codes
| Code | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 400 | Bad Request - Invalid parameters |
| 401 | Unauthorized - Authentication required |
| 403 | Forbidden - Insufficient permissions |
| 404 | Not Found - Resource does not exist |
| 409 | Conflict - Resource name already in use |
| 413 | Payload Too Large - Resource size exceeds limit |
| 429 | Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded |
Related Resources
Authentication
Users API
Webhooks API

title: Users API
content:
Users API
The Users API allows you to manage user accounts programmatically.
Endpoints
Get All Users
Retrieves a list of all users.
Query Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | integer | Page number for pagination (default: 1) |
|  | integer | Number of results per page (default: 20, max: 100) |
|  | string | Filter by user status (active, inactive, pending) |
|  | string | Filter by user role |
Response
Get User by ID
Retrieves a specific user by ID.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the user |
Response
Create User
Creates a new user.
Request Body
Response
Update User
Updates an existing user.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the user |
Request Body
Response
Delete User
Deletes a user.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the user |
Response
Error Codes
| Code | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 400 | Bad Request - Invalid parameters |
| 401 | Unauthorized - Authentication required |
| 403 | Forbidden - Insufficient permissions |
| 404 | Not Found - User does not exist |
| 409 | Conflict - Email already in use |
| 429 | Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded |
Related Resources
Authentication
Data API
Webhooks API

title: Webhooks API
content:
Webhooks API
The Webhooks API allows you to configure and manage webhook endpoints for receiving event notifications.
Webhook Events
Our system can send notifications for the following events:
| Event Type | Description |
|------------|-------------|
|  | A new user has been created |
|  | A user's information has been updated |
|  | A user has been deleted |
|  | A new data resource has been created |
|  | A data resource has been updated |
|  | A data resource has been deleted |
|  | A report has been generated |
|  | A system alert has been triggered |
Endpoints
Get All Webhooks
Retrieves a list of all configured webhooks.
Query Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | integer | Page number for pagination (default: 1) |
|  | integer | Number of results per page (default: 20, max: 100) |
|  | string | Filter by webhook status (active, inactive) |
|  | string | Filter by event type |
Response
Get Webhook by ID
Retrieves a specific webhook by ID.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the webhook |
Response
Create Webhook
Creates a new webhook endpoint.
Request Body
Response
Update Webhook
Updates an existing webhook.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the webhook |
Request Body
Response
Delete Webhook
Deletes a webhook.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the webhook |
Response
Test Webhook
Sends a test event to the webhook endpoint.
Path Parameters
| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
|  | string | The unique identifier of the webhook |
Request Body
Response
Webhook Payload Format
When an event occurs, we'll send a POST request to your webhook URL with the following payload format:
Webhook Security
All webhook requests include a signature in the  header. This signature is a HMAC SHA-256 hash of the request body using your webhook secret as the key.
Example code to verify the signature:
Error Codes
| Code | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 400 | Bad Request - Invalid parameters |
| 401 | Unauthorized - Authentication required |
| 403 | Forbidden - Insufficient permissions |
| 404 | Not Found - Webhook does not exist |
| 422 | Unprocessable Entity - Invalid webhook URL |
| 429 | Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded |
Related Resources
Authentication
Users API
Data API

title: Chatbot Overview
content:
Chatbot Overview
Our AI-powered chatbot is designed to help you quickly find answers to your questions and guide you through common tasks. The chatbot is available 24/7 and can assist with a wide range of topics.
What the Chatbot Can Help With
Documentation Navigation
Find specific documentation pages
Get quick summaries of topics
Navigate to relevant sections
Common Questions
Answer frequently asked questions
Provide step-by-step guidance
Explain technical concepts
Troubleshooting
Help diagnose common issues
Suggest solutions based on symptoms
Guide you to relevant troubleshooting resources
How to Use the Chatbot
Starting a Conversation
Click the chatbot icon in the bottom-right corner
Type your question in natural language
Press Enter or click Send
Best Practices
Be specific: Instead of "How do I install?", try "How do I install the software on Windows?"
Use keywords: Include relevant terms related to your question
Ask follow-up questions: The chatbot remembers context within a conversation
Example Questions
Chatbot Features
Smart Suggestions
The chatbot provides intelligent suggestions based on:
Your current page context
Popular documentation topics
Common user workflows
Code Examples
When relevant, the chatbot can provide:
Code snippets with syntax highlighting
Copy-to-clipboard functionality
Links to full examples in the documentation
Contextual Help
The chatbot understands:
Which section of documentation you're viewing
Your previous questions in the conversation
Common task sequences
Limitations
While our chatbot is quite capable, please note:
For complex technical issues, consider contacting our support team
The chatbot's knowledge is based on our documentation
For account-specific issues, you may need to speak with support
Feedback
Help us improve the chatbot by:
Rating responses as helpful or not helpful
Reporting any incorrect information
Suggesting new topics for the chatbot to learn
Getting Human Help
If the chatbot can't help with your question:
Click "Contact Support" in the chat interface
Use the "Need More Help?" section on any page
Email us directly at support@example.com
The chatbot will also automatically suggest contacting support for complex issues it cannot resolve.
headings: What the Chatbot Can Help With

title: Frequently Asked Questions
content:
Frequently Asked Questions
Find answers to the most common questions about our software.
General Questions
What is this software used for?
Our software is a comprehensive solution for businesses to manage data, users, and workflows. It provides tools for data analysis, reporting, user management, and integration with third-party services.
What platforms does the software support?
Our software runs on Windows, macOS, and Linux. We also offer cloud-hosted options that can be accessed from any modern web browser.
Is there a mobile app available?
Yes, we offer mobile apps for iOS and Android devices. These apps provide access to key features while on the go, though some advanced functionality may only be available in the desktop or web versions.
How often is the software updated?
We release major updates quarterly and minor updates/bug fixes monthly. Security patches are released as needed, typically within 48 hours of vulnerability discovery.
Licensing and Pricing
What licensing options are available?
We offer several licensing options:
Standard: For small teams with basic needs
Professional: For growing businesses with advanced requirements
Enterprise: For large organizations with custom needs
Cloud: Subscription-based access to our hosted solution
Is there a free trial available?
Yes, we offer a 14-day free trial of our Professional plan. No credit card is required to start the trial.
Can I upgrade my license later?
Yes, you can upgrade your license at any time. The price difference will be prorated based on the remaining time on your current license.
Do you offer discounts for non-profits or educational institutions?
Yes, we offer special pricing for qualified non-profit organizations, educational institutions, and open-source projects. Contact our sales team for details.
Installation and Setup
What are the system requirements?
Minimum system requirements:
CPU: Dual-core 2.0 GHz or higher
RAM: 4GB (8GB recommended)
Disk Space: 500MB for installation, plus storage for your data
Operating System: Windows 10+, macOS 10.15+, or Ubuntu 20.04+
Dependencies: Node.js 18+ and npm 8+
Can I install the software on multiple computers?
This depends on your license type:
Per-user licenses: Can be installed on multiple devices used by the same user
Per-device licenses: Limited to installation on a specific number of devices
Site licenses: Can be installed on any number of devices within your organization
How do I transfer my license to a new computer?
Deactivate the license on your old computer through Settings > License > Deactivate
Install the software on your new computer
Enter your license key during setup or in Settings > License
Can the software be installed on a server for multiple users?
Yes, our Enterprise edition supports server installation with multi-user access. Users connect via web browsers or thin clients.
Account Management
How do I reset my password?
Click the "Forgot Password" link on the login screen
Enter your email address
Follow the instructions in the password reset email
Create a new password
Can I change my username?
Usernames cannot be changed after account creation for security and audit purposes. However, administrators can create a new account and transfer data if necessary.
How do I add users to my organization?
Administrators can add users by:
Navigating to Settings > Users
Clicking "Add User"
Entering the user's details
Setting appropriate permissions
Clicking "Create User"
What permission levels are available?
Our software offers several built-in roles:
Viewer: Can view data but not modify it
Editor: Can view and modify data
Manager: Can manage users and data within assigned areas
Administrator: Has full access to all features
Custom Roles: Enterprise customers can create custom roles with specific permissions
Data Management
How is my data stored?
Data is stored in a secure database on your server or in our cloud environment, depending on your deployment option. All sensitive data is encrypted at rest using AES-256 encryption.
Can I import data from other systems?
Yes, our software supports importing data from:
CSV and Excel files
SQL databases
API connections to other systems
XML and JSON formats
How often should I back up my data?
We recommend daily backups for active systems. Our Enterprise edition includes automated backup scheduling.
Is there a limit to how much data I can store?
Local installations are limited only by your available storage. Cloud subscriptions include tiered storage limits based on your plan, with options to purchase additional storage.
Security
Is my data secure?
Yes, we implement multiple security measures:
End-to-end encryption for data in transit
AES-256 encryption for data at rest
Role-based access controls
Two-factor authentication
Regular security audits and penetration testing
Do you support two-factor authentication?
Yes, we support multiple two-factor authentication methods:
Time-based one-time passwords (TOTP)
SMS verification
Email verification
Hardware security keys (YubiKey, etc.)
Can I enforce password policies?
Yes, administrators can configure password policies including:
Minimum length
Required character types
Password expiration
Password history
Account lockout after failed attempts
How do you handle security vulnerabilities?
We have a dedicated security team that:
Conducts regular security audits
Monitors for vulnerabilities
Issues patches quickly for any discovered issues
Maintains a responsible disclosure program
Troubleshooting
The software is running slowly. What can I do?
Check your system resources (CPU, memory, disk space)
Close unnecessary applications
Clear the application cache in Settings > Maintenance
Optimize your database if you're an administrator
Consider upgrading your hardware if issues persist
I'm getting an error message. How do I fix it?
Check our Common Issues guide
Look for the specific error code in our Error Code Reference
Review the application logs in Settings > Logs
Contact support if the issue persists
How do I recover deleted data?
Check the Recycle Bin in the application
Administrators can restore from backups if available
Contact support if you need assistance with data recovery
The application won't start. What should I check?
Verify your system meets the minimum requirements
Check for conflicting software or services
Review the application logs
Try reinstalling the application
Contact support with details about the issue
Support and Training
How do I contact support?
You can contact support through:
The Help menu in the application
Our support portal at support.example.com
Email at support@example.com
Phone at 1-800-EXAMPLE (Enterprise customers)
Do you offer training?
Yes, we offer several training options:
Free online documentation and tutorials
Webinars and video tutorials
Virtual instructor-led training sessions
On-site training for Enterprise customers
What are your support hours?
Standard support is available Monday-Friday, 9am-5pm in all major time zones.
Enterprise customers have access to 24/7 support for critical issues.
Do you have a community forum?
Yes, our community forum is available at community.example.com where you can:
Ask questions
Share best practices
Connect with other users
Access community-created resources

Is there a free trial available?

title: Dashboard
content:
Dashboard Overview
The dashboard is your central hub for monitoring and managing all aspects of the system. This guide explains each component and how to use them effectively.
Dashboard Layout
The dashboard is divided into several key areas:
Navigation Sidebar: Access different sections of the application
Quick Stats: View important metrics at a glance
Recent Activity: See the latest events and actions
Performance Graphs: Monitor system performance
Alert Center: View and manage system alerts
Quick Stats
The Quick Stats section displays key metrics including:
Active Users: Number of users currently online
System Health: Overall system status
Pending Tasks: Tasks requiring attention
Resource Usage: CPU, memory, and storage utilization
Recent Activity
The Recent Activity feed shows the latest actions performed in the system:
User logins and logouts
Configuration changes
System events
Error occurrences
Click on any activity item to view more details.
Performance Graphs
The Performance Graphs section displays real-time and historical data on:
System response time
Request volume
Error rates
Resource utilization
Use the time range selector to adjust the displayed time period.
Alert Center
The Alert Center shows active alerts that require attention:
Critical Alerts: Require immediate action
Warning Alerts: Potential issues to monitor
Information Alerts: General system notifications
Click on an alert to view details and available actions.
Customizing Your Dashboard
You can customize the dashboard to show the information most relevant to you:
Click the Customize button in the top-right corner
Drag and drop widgets to rearrange them
Add or remove widgets as needed
Click Save Layout when finished
Related Resources
Navigation Guide
Features Overview
Common Tasks

title: Features Overview
content:
Features Overview
This guide provides a comprehensive overview of all features and capabilities available in our software.
Core Features
User Management
Our robust user management system allows you to:
Create and manage user accounts
Define custom roles and permissions
Implement single sign-on (SSO)
Track user activity and audit logs
Learn more about User Management
Data Processing
Process and analyze data with powerful tools:
Import data from multiple sources
Apply transformations and filters
Create custom processing pipelines
Schedule automated processing jobs
Learn more about Data Processing
Reporting
Generate comprehensive reports:
Create custom report templates
Schedule automated report generation
Export in multiple formats (PDF, CSV, Excel)
Share reports with stakeholders
Learn more about Reporting
API Integration
Connect with other systems through our API:
RESTful API endpoints
Webhook support
OAuth 2.0 authentication
Rate limiting and usage monitoring
Learn more about API Integration
Advanced Features
Automation
Streamline workflows with automation:
Create custom automation rules
Set up triggers and actions
Schedule recurring tasks
Monitor automation performance
Learn more about Automation
Analytics
Gain insights with advanced analytics:
Real-time data visualization
Custom dashboards
Trend analysis
Predictive analytics
Learn more about Analytics
Security
Protect your data with enterprise-grade security:
Role-based access control
Data encryption
Two-factor authentication
Security audit logs
Learn more about Security
Integration Capabilities
Third-Party Integrations
Connect with popular services:
CRM systems
Marketing platforms
Payment processors
Communication tools
Learn more about Integrations
Custom Extensions
Extend functionality with custom extensions:
Plugin architecture
Custom modules
Scripting capabilities
Webhooks for external triggers
Learn more about Extensions
Related Resources
Dashboard Overview
Navigation Guide
API Reference

title: Navigation Guide
content:
Navigation Guide
This guide explains how to navigate the user interface and find the features you need quickly.
Main Navigation Components
Top Navigation Bar
The top navigation bar contains:
Logo: Click to return to the dashboard
Search: Find features, documentation, and content
Notifications: View system notifications and alerts
User Menu: Access your profile and account settings
Help: Access documentation and support resources
Sidebar Navigation
The sidebar provides access to all main sections:
Dashboard: Return to the main dashboard
Users: Manage user accounts and permissions
Data: Access data management tools
Reports: Generate and view reports
Settings: Configure system settings
Tools: Access utility tools and features
Click the expand/collapse button at the bottom of the sidebar to toggle between full and compact views.
Navigation Tips
Keyboard Shortcuts
| Shortcut | Action |
|----------|--------|
|  | Open search |
|  | Go to dashboard |
|  | Go to users |
|  | Go to settings |
|  | Open help |
Breadcrumb Navigation
Breadcrumbs at the top of each page show your current location and allow you to navigate back to parent sections.
Recent Items
The "Recent" section in the sidebar shows your recently accessed pages for quick navigation.
Favorites
Star any page to add it to your favorites for quick access. Manage your favorites in the user menu.
Mobile Navigation
On mobile devices:
Tap the menu icon (☰) to open the sidebar
Use the bottom navigation bar for essential functions
Swipe right from the left edge to open the sidebar
Swipe down to access search
Context Menus
Right-click (or long press on mobile) on items to access context menus with additional options.
Related Resources
Dashboard Overview
Features Overview
Common Tasks

title: Common Tasks
content:
Common Tasks
This guide covers the most common tasks you'll perform with our software. Use this as a quick reference for day-to-day operations.
User Management
Adding a New User
Navigate to Settings > Users
Click the Add User button
Fill in the required information
Set appropriate permissions
Click Save
Modifying User Permissions
Navigate to Settings > Users
Find the user in the list and click Edit
Adjust permissions as needed
Click Save Changes
Data Management
Importing Data
Navigate to Data > Import
Select the data source type
Upload your file or connect to external source
Map the fields
Click Start Import
Exporting Reports
Navigate to Reports
Select the report template
Set date range and filters
Click Generate Report
Choose export format (PDF, CSV, Excel)
Account Settings
Updating Profile Information
Click your profile icon in the top-right corner
Select Profile Settings
Update your information
Click Save Changes
Changing Password
Navigate to Profile > Security
Enter your current password
Enter and confirm your new password
Click Update Password
Troubleshooting
If you encounter issues while performing these tasks, please refer to our Troubleshooting Guide or contact support.
Related Resources
Dashboard Overview
Feature Guide
API Documentation

Run the initialization command
Next Steps

title: Installation
content:
Installation
This guide provides detailed instructions for installing our software on various platforms.
System Requirements
Before installing, ensure your system meets the following requirements:
Operating System: Windows 10+, macOS 10.15+, or Ubuntu 20.04+
Memory: Minimum 4GB RAM (8GB recommended)
Disk Space: At least 500MB of free disk space
Dependencies: Node.js 18+ and npm 8+
Installation Methods
Method 1: Using npm (Recommended)
The easiest way to install our software is through npm:
Method 2: Direct Download
Visit our downloads page
Select the appropriate version for your operating system
Run the installer and follow the on-screen instructions
Method 3: Using Docker
Verifying Installation
To verify that the installation was successful, run:
You should see the current version number displayed in your terminal.
Next Steps
Configuration Guide
Getting Started
Dashboard Overview

title: Common Issues
content:
Common Issues
This guide provides solutions for frequently encountered problems with our software.
Installation Issues
Error: "Unable to install dependencies"
Symptoms:
Installation fails with dependency-related errors
Error message mentions missing packages or libraries
Solutions:
Ensure your system meets the minimum requirements
Update your package manager:
Clear package manager cache:
Try installing with the verbose flag for more information:
   
Error: "Permission denied"
Symptoms:
Installation fails with permission errors
Error message mentions "EACCES" or "permission denied"
Solutions:
Use administrator privileges:
Fix npm permissions:
   
Login Issues
Error: "Invalid credentials"
Symptoms:
Unable to log in despite using correct username/password
Repeated login failures
Solutions:
Reset your password using the "Forgot Password" link
Check if Caps Lock is enabled
Clear browser cookies and cache
Try a different browser
Contact your administrator to check if your account is locked
Error: "Account locked"
Symptoms:
Message indicating your account has been locked
Unable to log in even with correct credentials
Solutions:
Wait for the lockout period to expire (typically 15-30 minutes)
Contact your administrator to unlock the account
Reset your password using the "Forgot Password" link
Performance Issues
Slow Loading Times
Symptoms:
Pages take a long time to load
Operations are sluggish
Timeouts occur during operations
Solutions:
Check your internet connection
Clear browser cache and cookies
Disable browser extensions that might interfere
Check system resources (CPU, memory) on the server
Optimize database queries if you're an administrator
Consider upgrading your server resources
High Memory Usage
Symptoms:
System becomes unresponsive
Error messages about memory limits
Application crashes
Solutions:
Close unnecessary applications and browser tabs
Increase system memory if possible
Configure memory limits in the application settings
Optimize database queries and indexes
Implement data pagination for large datasets
Data Import/Export Issues
Import Fails with Format Errors
Symptoms:
Data import fails
Error message mentions invalid format or structure
Solutions:
Verify your file format matches the expected format
Check for special characters or encoding issues
Ensure column headers match expected field names
Try exporting a sample from the system and compare structures
Break large imports into smaller batches
Export Times Out
Symptoms:
Export process starts but never completes
Browser shows loading indicator indefinitely
Solutions:
Reduce the amount of data being exported
Use filters to export only necessary records
Try exporting during off-peak hours
Use the scheduled export feature instead of interactive export
Check server timeout settings
API Connection Issues
Error: "API rate limit exceeded"
Symptoms:
API requests fail with 429 status code
Error message mentions rate limiting
Solutions:
Reduce the frequency of API calls
Implement request batching
Add retry logic with exponential backoff
Request a higher rate limit from your administrator
Optimize your code to use fewer API calls
Error: "Invalid API key"
Symptoms:
API requests fail with 401 status code
Error message mentions authentication failure
Solutions:
Verify your API key is correct
Generate a new API key if necessary
Check if the API key has expired
Ensure you're using the correct authentication method
Verify the API key has the necessary permissions
Integration Issues
Third-Party Integration Failures
Symptoms:
Integration with external services fails
Error messages about connection or authentication
Solutions:
Verify API keys and credentials for the third-party service
Check if the third-party service is operational
Review integration logs for specific error messages
Test the connection using the integration test tool
Check for changes in the third-party API that might require updates
Webhook Delivery Failures
Symptoms:
Webhooks are not being received
Events aren't triggering expected actions
Solutions:
Verify the webhook URL is correct and accessible
Check webhook logs for delivery attempts and responses
Ensure the receiving server can accept incoming connections
Test with a simple payload to isolate the issue
Check for firewall or security settings blocking webhook delivery
Reporting Issues
Reports Show Incorrect Data
Symptoms:
Report results don't match expected values
Calculations appear incorrect
Solutions:
Verify the report parameters and filters
Check the date range selection
Ensure data sources are properly configured
Review the report logic and calculations
Compare with raw data to identify discrepancies
Report Generation Fails
Symptoms:
Unable to generate reports
Error message during report creation
Solutions:
Check if the data source is available
Verify you have permission to access the data
Reduce the complexity of the report
Try a smaller date range
Check for custom code or formulas that might be causing errors
Still Need Help?
If you're still experiencing issues after trying these solutions:
Check our FAQ section
Search the knowledge base
Contact support through your account
Post your question in our community forum
For enterprise customers, contact your dedicated support representative

title: Customization Guide
content:
Customization Guide
This guide will show you how to customize the software to match your organization's branding and workflow requirements.
Prerequisites
Before starting this tutorial, make sure you have:
[ ] Completed the Installation Tutorial
[ ] Completed the Configuration Guide
[ ] Administrator access to the software
[ ] Your organization's branding assets (logo, colors, etc.)
Step 1: Access Customization Settings
Log in to the application with your administrator account
Navigate to Settings > Customization
You'll see several tabs for different customization options
Step 2: Branding Customization
Logo and Favicon
Click on the "Branding" tab
Under "Logo Settings":
Click "Upload Logo" and select your organization's logo
Recommended size: 200px × 50px, PNG or SVG format
Preview how it looks in the header
Under "Favicon Settings":
Click "Upload Favicon" and select your icon
Must be ICO, PNG, or SVG format, 32px × 32px
Click "Save Changes"
Color Scheme
Still in the "Branding" tab, scroll to "Color Scheme"
You can either:
Select a predefined color theme
Create a custom color scheme
For custom colors, set:
Primary Color: Main brand color
Secondary Color: Accent color
Background Color: Page background
Text Color: Main text color
Preview the changes in real-time
Click "Save Changes"
Step 3: Layout Customization
Navigate to the "Layout" tab
Configure the following options:
Header Layout
Choose header style:
Standard (logo left, menu right)
Centered (logo center, menu below)
Compact (all elements in one row)
Select which elements to display:
Search bar
Notifications
User menu
Help button
Sidebar Customization
Choose sidebar style:
Expanded (always visible)
Collapsible (can be toggled)
Mini (icons only)
Select default state (expanded/collapsed)
Choose position (left/right)
Dashboard Layout
Select default dashboard layout:
Grid layout (widgets in a grid)
Column layout (widgets in columns)
Configure number of columns/rows
Set widget spacing
Step 4: Content Customization
Navigate to the "Content" tab
Customize the following elements:
Welcome Message
Enable/disable welcome message
Enter custom welcome text
Set display duration
Custom Pages
Click "Create Custom Page"
Enter page title
Use the rich text editor to create content
Set page visibility and access permissions
Choose where to display in navigation
Legal Documents
Upload or create:
Terms of Service
Privacy Policy
Data Processing Agreement
Set version number and effective date
Step 5: Email Template Customization
Navigate to the "Email Templates" tab
Select a template to customize:
Welcome Email
Password Reset
Notification Emails
Report Delivery
For each template:
Customize subject line
Edit email content using the template editor
Add your logo and branding
Preview the email
Click "Save Template"
Step 6: Custom CSS and JavaScript
For advanced customization:
Navigate to the "Advanced" tab
In the "Custom CSS" section:
Enter CSS rules to override default styles
Use the preview to see changes in real-time
In the "Custom JavaScript" section:
Add custom JavaScript for advanced functionality
Note: Custom JavaScript is subject to security review
Example custom CSS:
Step 7: User Role Customization
Navigate to the "Roles" tab
You can either:
Modify existing roles
Create new custom roles
For each role:
Set permissions
Configure access to features
Set UI customizations specific to the role
Step 8: Workflow Customization
Navigate to the "Workflows" tab
You can customize:
Approval processes
Notification rules
Automated actions
Create custom workflows using the visual workflow editor
Step 9: Save and Apply Customizations
Review all your customization settings
Click "Save All Changes"
Choose when to apply changes:
Immediately
During scheduled maintenance
At specific date/time
Confirm when prompted
Testing Your Customizations
After applying customizations:
Log out and log back in to see all changes
Test on different devices and screen sizes
Ask colleagues for feedback
Check all major features to ensure functionality wasn't affected
Exporting and Importing Customizations
You can save your customization settings to apply to other instances:
Navigate to "Advanced" tab
Click "Export Customizations"
Save the JSON configuration file
To import on another instance:
Navigate to "Advanced" tab
Click "Import Customizations"
Select your saved configuration file
Next Steps
White Labeling Guide
Custom Widget Development
Theme Development

title: Configuration Guide
content:
Configuration Guide
This guide will walk you through configuring the software to meet your specific requirements.
Prerequisites
Before starting this tutorial, make sure you have:
[ ] Completed the Installation Tutorial
[ ] Administrator access to the software
[ ] Basic understanding of your organization's requirements
Step 1: Access Configuration Settings
Log in to the application with your administrator account
Click on your profile icon in the top-right corner
Select "Settings" from the dropdown menu
Navigate to the "System Configuration" tab
Step 2: General Settings
Configure the basic system settings:
System Name: Enter a name for your installation (e.g., "Company Name Portal")
Default Language: Select your preferred language
Time Zone: Choose your organization's time zone
Date Format: Select your preferred date format
Currency: Choose your default currency
Click "Save Changes"
Step 3: User Authentication Settings
Configure how users will authenticate:
Navigate to "Authentication" in the settings menu
Choose your authentication method:
Local Authentication: Username and password stored in the system
LDAP/Active Directory: Connect to your organization's directory service
Single Sign-On (SSO): Configure SAML or OAuth integration
Configure the selected authentication method:
Local Authentication
Set password requirements:
Minimum length
Required character types
Password expiration policy
Configure multi-factor authentication (optional)
Set account lockout policy
LDAP/Active Directory
Enter LDAP server details:
Server URL
Bind DN and password
User search base
Group search base
Test the connection
Configure attribute mapping
Single Sign-On
Select your identity provider (IdP)
Upload metadata XML or enter endpoint URLs
Configure attribute mapping
Test the SSO connection
Step 4: Email Configuration
Set up email notifications:
Navigate to "Email Settings"
Enter SMTP server details:
Server address
Port
Username and password
Encryption method (TLS/SSL)
Configure sender email address and name
Test the email configuration
Select which events should trigger email notifications
Step 5: Storage Configuration
Configure where data will be stored:
Navigate to "Storage Settings"
Choose your storage type:
Local Storage: Files stored on the server
Cloud Storage: Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, etc.
Configure the selected storage option:
Local Storage
Set the storage directory path
Configure backup settings
Set file size limits
Cloud Storage
Enter your cloud provider credentials
Configure bucket/container name
Set region and access policies
Test the connection
Step 6: Advanced Settings
Configure additional system settings:
API Access: Enable/disable API and configure rate limits
Logging: Set log levels and retention policy
Performance: Configure caching and optimization settings
Security: Set up IP restrictions and security policies
Integrations: Configure third-party service connections
Step 7: Save and Apply Configuration
Review all your configuration settings
Click "Save All Changes"
Confirm when prompted
The system may need to restart to apply some changes
Verifying Configuration
After completing the configuration:
Test key functionality to ensure everything works as expected
Check system logs for any errors or warnings
Verify that users can authenticate properly
Test email notifications
Confirm that data is being stored correctly
Configuration File Reference
For advanced users, you can directly edit the configuration file:
Next Steps
User Management Tutorial
Data Import Guide
Security Best Practices

title: Installation Tutorial
content:
Installation Tutorial
This tutorial will guide you through the process of installing our software on your system.
Prerequisites
Before you begin, make sure you have:
[ ] Administrator access to your system
[ ] Node.js 18 or higher installed
[ ] At least 500MB of free disk space
[ ] A stable internet connection
Step 1: Download the Software
Visit our downloads page
Select the appropriate version for your operating system:
Windows:  installer
macOS:  installer
Linux:  or  package
Step 2: Run the Installer
Windows
Double-click the downloaded  file
If prompted by User Account Control, click "Yes"
Follow the installation wizard instructions
Choose your installation directory or use the default
Select which components to install
Click "Install"
macOS
Open the downloaded  file
Drag the application icon to your Applications folder
Enter your administrator password if prompted
Wait for the installation to complete
Linux
For Debian-based distributions (Ubuntu, Debian):
For RPM-based distributions (Fedora, CentOS):
Step 3: Verify Installation
Open a terminal or command prompt
Run the following command:
You should see the current version number displayed
Step 4: Initial Configuration
Launch the application
You'll be prompted to create an administrator account
Fill in the required information:
Username
Password
Email address
Click "Create Account"
Follow the initial setup wizard to configure basic settings
Step 5: Activate Your License
Navigate to Settings > License
Enter your license key
Click "Activate"
You should see a confirmation message
Troubleshooting
Common Installation Issues
Error: "Dependency not found"
This usually means a required system library is missing. Install the missing dependency:
Error: "Permission denied"
Make sure you have administrator privileges when installing the software.
Error: "Port already in use"
The default port (3000) is already being used by another application. You can change the port in the configuration file after installation.
Next Steps
Configuration Guide
User Management
Dashboard Overview

title: Third-Party Integrations
content:
Third-Party Integrations
This guide explains how to integrate our software with popular third-party tools and services to extend functionality and streamline your workflows.
Prerequisites
Before starting this tutorial, make sure you have:
[ ] Completed the Installation Tutorial
[ ] Completed the Configuration Guide
[ ] Administrator access to the software
[ ] Access to the third-party services you want to integrate with
Available Integrations
Our software supports integration with the following categories of third-party tools:
CRM Systems
Salesforce
HubSpot
Microsoft Dynamics 365
Zoho CRM
Marketing Platforms
Mailchimp
Marketo
HubSpot Marketing
SendGrid
Communication Tools
Slack
Microsoft Teams
Discord
Zoom
Project Management
Jira
Asana
Trello
Monday.com
File Storage
Google Drive
Dropbox
OneDrive
Box
Analytics
Google Analytics
Mixpanel
Amplitude
Segment
Integration Methods
Our software offers several methods to integrate with third-party services:
Pre-built Connectors: Ready-to-use integrations with popular services
Webhook Integration: Send and receive data via webhooks
API Integration: Use our API to build custom integrations
OAuth Authentication: Connect securely with third-party services
Step 1: Access Integration Settings
Log in to the application with your administrator account
Navigate to Settings > Integrations
You'll see a list of available integration categories
Step 2: Set Up a Pre-built Connector
Let's walk through setting up a Slack integration as an example:
In the Integrations dashboard, find "Slack" under Communication Tools
Click "Connect" or "Set Up"
You'll be redirected to Slack's authorization page
Sign in to your Slack workspace if needed
Review the permissions requested
Click "Allow" to authorize the connection
You'll be redirected back to our application
Configure integration-specific settings:
Select channels for notifications
Choose which events trigger Slack messages
Customize message formats
Click "Save Configuration"
Step 3: Configure Webhook Integration
For services without pre-built connectors, you can use webhooks:
In the Integrations dashboard, click "Custom Webhook"
Click "Create New Webhook"
Configure the webhook:
Enter a name for the integration
Provide the webhook URL from the third-party service
Select events that should trigger the webhook
Configure the payload format if needed
Test the webhook by clicking "Send Test Event"
Verify that the third-party service received the test event
Click "Save Configuration"
Step 4: API Integration
For more complex integrations, you can use our API:
Navigate to Settings > API Access
Generate a new API key if you don't have one
Copy your API key and keep it secure
Use our API Documentation to build your integration
Register your integration in Settings > Integrations > Custom API Integration
Step 5: OAuth Authentication
To allow users to connect their own accounts:
In the Integrations dashboard, select the service you want to enable
Click "Configure OAuth"
Register an OAuth application with the third-party service
Enter the client ID and secret provided by the service
Configure redirect URLs
Set permission scopes
Save the configuration
Users can now connect their accounts from their profile settings
Common Integration Examples
Salesforce Integration
Navigate to Integrations > CRM Systems > Salesforce
Click "Connect"
Log in to your Salesforce account
Configure data mapping:
Map user fields to Salesforce contacts
Configure lead creation rules
Set up opportunity tracking
Set up bi-directional sync options
Configure sync frequency
Click "Save Configuration"
Slack Notifications
Navigate to Integrations > Communication Tools > Slack
Click "Connect" and authorize
Configure notification settings:
New user registrations
Important system alerts
Report completions
Custom events
Customize message templates
Select destination channels
Click "Save Configuration"
Google Analytics
Navigate to Integrations > Analytics > Google Analytics
Click "Connect"
Log in to your Google account
Select your Google Analytics property
Configure tracking options:
Page views
Events
User properties
Custom dimensions
Add tracking code to custom pages if needed
Click "Save Configuration"
Troubleshooting Integration Issues
Authentication Failures
Verify API keys and secrets are correct
Check that OAuth tokens haven't expired
Confirm that the integration has the necessary permissions
Look for changes in the third-party API that might affect the integration
Data Sync Issues
Check sync logs in Integrations > Logs
Verify field mappings are correct
Look for data format incompatibilities
Check for rate limiting issues
Webhook Delivery Problems
Verify the webhook URL is correct and accessible
Check that the receiving service is properly configured to accept webhooks
Review webhook logs for delivery attempts and responses
Test with a simple payload to isolate the issue
Best Practices
Start Small: Begin with one or two critical integrations before adding more
Monitor Performance: Regularly check integration logs for errors or performance issues
Update Regularly: Keep integrations updated as third-party APIs evolve
Secure Credentials: Store API keys and secrets securely
Test Thoroughly: Always test integrations in a staging environment first
Next Steps
API Authentication Guide
Webhook Configuration
Custom Integration Development
Data Mapping Guide
headings: Step 2: Set Up a Pre-built Connector
